item.title: SSD1306 oled display i2c interface with bus pirate
item.description: I2C is a synchronous serial bus invented by philips semiconductors (now NXP semiconductors). The communication is based on a 7-bit address limited to 112 devices on the bus (There are some reserved addresses). Although some newer devices support 10-bit addressing mode. I2C protocol uses 2 wires (3 if GND is considered). SDA for synchronous data and SCL for clock line. The clock is always generated by the master. to send data to a slave:
